intro: Atropis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered atropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, small white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. Atropis parviflora is often found in the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.
